sense.name: become skilled at or understand thoroughly
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] MASTER NP2[topic] Note: NP2 in this sense is NOT AFFECTED by NP1's domination of NP2.
sense.examples: The tech giant has mastered the art of acquisitions. Have you mastered the essentials of e-mail security? He has mastered the language of love. She finally mastered Chinese after years of study.

sense.name: become master of, overcome, dominate
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] MASTER NP2[patient] Note: NP2 in this sense IS AFFECTED by NP1's domination of NP2, if only in a metaphorical sense.
sense.examples: They mastered the Germans and repulsed their Pierce counterattacks. I believe her mare has mastered her. Read how one woman successfully mastered her addiction. With that realization, fatigue mastered him. You must master your fate!
